content.rendered:
[vc_row full_width=”stretch_row_content_no_spaces” css=”.vc_custom_1568820823990{padding-top: 30vh !important;padding-bottom: 20vh !important;background-image: url(https://www.atrinternational.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/bigstock-American-flag-26598290.jpg?id=5645) !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}” el_class=”custom-overlay gradient-overlay”][vc_column css_animation=”fadeIn”][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text]

ATR’s Military Commitment:

Veteran’s Employment Program

 

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle”][vc_column css_animation=”fadeIn” css=”.vc_custom_1548112759237{padding-top: 120px !important;}”][vc_column_text]

Employing veterans across the country

 

If you’ve served in the U.S. military, you’ve sacrificed a lot during your life. Parades, awards, and handshakes are great ways to show gratitude, but they’re not enough. The amount of courage and dedication you’ve displayed shouldn’t just be celebrated—it should be rewarded. 

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width=”2/3″][vc_column_text]

Reenter the workforce

 

That’s why we created ATR’s Military Commitment, a program focused on placing veterans in contract and internal positions across America. Those who return to the workforce after their military service face unique barriers to employment, and ATR provides the additional support and career counseling necessary for reacclimating to civilian working life. 

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/3″][vc_single_image image=”5641″ img_size=”full”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/3″][vc_single_image image=”5746″ img_size=”full”][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”2/3″][vc_column_text]

 

Careers are our specialty

 

Many military candidates have been employed through ATR over the years, proving that the traits that helped you serve this country are the same that can lead to a successful career. Our specialty is harnessing your skills and finding the right role to apply them to. It’s the least we can do to say  thank you for all that you’ve already done for us. 

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column]

Take the next step in your career.
Get in touch with us today.

View Contract Jobs

View Internal Positions

Quick Apply

[vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

When Heroes Speak, ATR Listens

[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner gap=”10″][vc_column_inner width=”1/2″][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/2″][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column]

ATR Military Spotlight

Why Employing Military Veterans & Spouses Is Critical for Businesses

12.15.2023 | Hiring, Hiring Manager Blogs, Podcasts, Veteran Program

Last month’s Veterans Day ceremonies around the country, honoring the men and women of our armed forces, were beautiful and moving. We are in debt to all those who choose to serve and protect our nation, whether it is for a few years or a full career. November was also Military Family Appreciation month, because […]

Read the Article

3 Ways to Maximize Veteran Job Support from a Staffing Agency

12.04.2023 | Career Advice, Job Search, Veteran Program

As a veteran, you’ve developed exceptional skills that can be applied to any workplace. Everything you’ve learned during your time in service—from cultivating leadership skills and strong work ethic to building resilience and clear communication skills—can make you an asset in your next career. But stigmas against veterans can lead to challenges in your job […]

Read the Article

7 Key Benefits of Hiring Veterans & Military Spouses

11.21.2023 | ATR International, Hiring, Hiring Manager Blogs, Veteran Program

Pride for our American heroes is deeply woven into the fabric of our nation, but appreciation has yet to lead to inclusion in the hiring game. Veterans continue to endure stigmas that bind them to low-skill positions—and the military spouses supporting active-duty personnel face an unwavering 22% unemployment rate. But for employers, there’s a growing […]

Read the Article

[/vc_column][/vc_row]
